meta.subject: Geography
meta.source: SQA Higher Geography course specification and supplied glossary

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Population count and survey that is carried out every 10 years in most countries.
cards.use: Be able to define census clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Study of population structure.
cards.use: Be able to define demographic clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: The movement of people from one place to another. Movement from within a country is called internal migration, and between two different countries it is called international migration.
cards.use: Be able to define migration clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: When people move away from one country.
cards.use: Be able to define emigration clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: The movement of people from their country of origin to another in search of safety from war, environmental disaster or religious or ethnic persecution.
cards.use: Be able to define forced migration clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: The movement of people from one place to another based on family links or economic prospects.
cards.use: Be able to define voluntary migration clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Term given to people who flee their home country in search of safety.
cards.use: Be able to define refugee clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: When people decide to settle somewhere else permanently.
cards.use: Be able to define long-term migration clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Seasonal migration of agricultural workers or international students studying abroad for their degrees, for example.
cards.use: Be able to define short-term migration clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: When people leave their homes in the countryside in search of education or employment in the city.
cards.use: Be able to define rural-urban migration clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: When people leave their city lives in search of a quieter life in the countryside.
cards.use: Be able to define urban-rural migration clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: When people move out of the city and inner city to live in the countryside.
cards.use: Be able to define counter-urbanisation clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: An urban settlement with a population of more than 10 million.
cards.use: Be able to define megacity clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: When towns and cities grow out into the countryside.
cards.use: Be able to define urban sprawl clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: The growth of towns and cities.
cards.use: Be able to define urbanisation clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: When farmers grow crops and rear animals to feed just themselves and their family, and not to sell.
cards.use: Be able to define subsistence farming clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Growing interconnection between places through flows of goods, services, people, capital and information.
cards.use: Be able to define globalisation clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Improvements in peopleâ€™s living conditions and wellbeing, often measured using social and economic indicators.
cards.use: Be able to define development clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Overall wellbeing, often measured using indicators such as health, income, housing and access to services.
cards.use: Be able to define quality of life clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: A state of physical and mental wellbeing.
cards.use: Be able to define health clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: An illness or condition that affects health.
cards.use: Be able to define disease clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Support given to people, organisations or countries, usually as money, goods or services, to help development or respond to emergencies.
cards.use: Be able to define aid clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: The buying and selling of goods and services between places or countries.
cards.use: Be able to define trade clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Development that meets present needs without damaging the environment or limiting future generations.
cards.use: In an environment question, use sustainable development to explain impacts and possible responses.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: The number of people living in a place.
cards.use: Be able to define population clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Relating to towns and cities.
cards.use: Be able to define urban clearly in one sentence.

cards.subject: Geography
cards.back: Relating to the countryside.
cards.use: Be able to define rural clearly in one sentence.
